result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Allen Diels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department and 1/2 can be served on Electronic Monitor, if qualify according to jail rules. May serve in Forrest County, if each County agrees. no credit.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Submit a DNA sample.
Sign releases for Agent to montior.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
 Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
No contact with Jared Hansan.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission
Count 2

11:28 a.m. Defendant Devon Allen Diels in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 1 is dismissed and read in.
DA makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation and requests expungement and transfer to Forrest County. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
Count 2: I/S Sentence
6 month jail w/huber and 1/2 can be served on Electronic Monitor, if qualify may serve in Forrest County, if county agrees. no credit.
24 mo Probation
$200 fine + costs + Drug Surcharges + DNA surcharge
DNA sample
Complete 60 hrs Community Services
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Sign releases for Agent to montior.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
 Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
No contact with Jared Hansan.
 Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Expungement option, if sucessfully completes.

Defendant Devon Allen Diels in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:50 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
